title: The FALL of DUSSELDORF
body_text:
The CREAMation 4
McCrorey, last-minute substitute Basista face off
In one of the year's newsmakers, the wildly intense Travis Mills was unable to attend this 116th extravaganza. But despite his unforunate absence, fans and spectators alike expected to see the proposed
CREAMation 4
- and that's exactly what they got!
Rookie-of-the-year candidate Sascha Basista stepped up to the plate a mere minutes before showtime, accepting the challenge of one of the most recognized figures to ever set foot on the dodgeball battlegrounds, Mr. Ryan McCrorey.
Flash Results by Game
McCrorey: 1, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 12
Basista: 2, 5, 10, 11
The flash results do not lie as the 18 year-old sensation was in for a fight. The conclusion of the fifth round spelled doom for the young prodigy. Team MCCROREY with such allies like catching phenom Ryan Letsche and the ever-accurate Kevin Adams tackled the obstacle that stood ahead. Basista's attempted comeback came way late in the event and thus, he was
CREAMated
.
Ryan McCrorey defeated Sascha Basista, 8 to 4, with
CREAMation Rules
on the line.
Moments & Stars
: Mike Edwards guarded by a garbage can; Sascha Basista darting and eventually captured following 116's official end
What Happened?
The decline in attendance can perhaps be credited to a number of factors: the coming of final exams; last-minute holiday shopping; the cold, wet weather.
Plus, legendary big mouth Justin Pierce may have suffered the game's plaguing finger injury. We here at
dodgeball.livejournal.com
hope to have update on his condition and certainly wish him well.
RECORDS
> Attendance: 17
> New Players: (0)
- The attendance of DODGEBALL 116 saw a rather large drop when compared to the last couple of weeks. The turnout of 17 is the lowest since DODGEBALL 77 in late-February.
- After 27 weeks of dry weather, the streak came to an end at DODGEBALL 116. Not only was DODGEBALL 116
Wet War XXII
, it was also the third
Snow War
. Three of the four
CREAMation Rules
encounters have been
Wet Wars
as well (the Adams/Fitzpatrick at DODGEBALL 105 was not).
- Even the match made headlines! Scheduled participant Travis Mills was unable to attend and one Sascha Basista would take his place at the very last minute. Basista unfortunately would lose the confrontation against Ryan McCrorey, 8 to 4, and reluctantly get
CREAMated
.
- This was the second straight week Basista was captain. He lost both matches and moves to 2-4-1. McCrorey returned after well over a year out of the captains chair. This win improves his record to 2-1-1.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
DODGEBALL ONE-SEVENTEEN: 12.22.07
A Christmas gift indeed ...
John Tronolone
clashes with
Tom Adams
for the very first time ever. Plus, listen up for the DODGEBALL CXX main event announcement.
DODGEBALL 118: Friday, 12.28.07
BoxBall Dodgeball
kicks off two back-to-back nights of non-stop action!
DODGEBALL 119: Saturday, 12.29.07
The test of endurance continues - what will happen at 119?
DODGEBALL CXX: 1.5.08
The 2007
Gold Awards
presented as well as the colossal season finale main event, that to be announced at DODGEBALL ONE-SEVENTEEN.
body_html:
The CREAMation 4
McCrorey, last-minute substitute Basista face off
In one of the year's newsmakers, the wildly intense Travis Mills was unable to attend this 116th extravaganza. But despite his unforunate absence, fans and spectators alike expected to see the proposed CREAMation 4 - and that's exactly what they got!

Rookie-of-the-year candidate Sascha Basista stepped up to the plate a mere minutes before showtime, accepting the challenge of one of the most recognized figures to ever set foot on the dodgeball battlegrounds, Mr. Ryan McCrorey.

Flash Results by Game
McCrorey: 1, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 12
Basista: 2, 5, 10, 11

The flash results do not lie as the 18 year-old sensation was in for a fight. The conclusion of the fifth round spelled doom for the young prodigy. Team MCCROREY with such allies like catching phenom Ryan Letsche and the ever-accurate Kevin Adams tackled the obstacle that stood ahead. Basista's attempted comeback came way late in the event and thus, he was CREAMated.

Ryan McCrorey defeated Sascha Basista, 8 to 4, with CREAMation Rules on the line.

Moments & Stars: Mike Edwards guarded by a garbage can; Sascha Basista darting and eventually captured following 116's official end

What Happened?
The decline in attendance can perhaps be credited to a number of factors: the coming of final exams; last-minute holiday shopping; the cold, wet weather.

Plus, legendary big mouth Justin Pierce may have suffered the game's plaguing finger injury. We here at dodgeball.livejournal.com hope to have update on his condition and certainly wish him well.

RECORDS
> Attendance: 17
> New Players: (0)

- The attendance of DODGEBALL 116 saw a rather large drop when compared to the last couple of weeks. The turnout of 17 is the lowest since DODGEBALL 77 in late-February.
- After 27 weeks of dry weather, the streak came to an end at DODGEBALL 116. Not only was DODGEBALL 116 Wet War XXII, it was also the third Snow War. Three of the four CREAMation Rules encounters have been Wet Wars as well (the Adams/Fitzpatrick at DODGEBALL 105 was not).
- Even the match made headlines! Scheduled participant Travis Mills was unable to attend and one Sascha Basista would take his place at the very last minute. Basista unfortunately would lose the confrontation against Ryan McCrorey, 8 to 4, and reluctantly get CREAMated.
- This was the second straight week Basista was captain. He lost both matches and moves to 2-4-1. McCrorey returned after well over a year out of the captains chair. This win improves his record to 2-1-1.

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

DODGEBALL ONE-SEVENTEEN: 12.22.07
A Christmas gift indeed ... John Tronolone clashes with Tom Adams for the very first time ever. Plus, listen up for the DODGEBALL CXX main event announcement.

DODGEBALL 118: Friday, 12.28.07
BoxBall Dodgeball kicks off two back-to-back nights of non-stop action!
DODGEBALL 119: Saturday, 12.29.07
The test of endurance continues - what will happen at 119?

DODGEBALL CXX: 1.5.08
The 2007 Gold Awards presented as well as the colossal season finale main event, that to be announced at DODGEBALL ONE-SEVENTEEN.
